title.value: Recurrent Real-Valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator for Online Density Estimation and Classification of Streaming Data
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the paper: 'Recurrent Real-Valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator for Online Density Estimation and Classification of Streaming Data'.
title.quote: Recurrent Real-Valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator for Online Density Estimation and Classification of Streaming Data

extractions.description: This paper introduces the Recurrent Real-valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator (RRNADE), a novel model for online classification and density estimation of streaming data. Combining a neural Gaussian mixture density module with a recurrent module, RRNADE addresses challenges in online learning settings such as concept drift and temporal correlations. It outperforms several existing density-based and non-density-based online classification methods in various tasks and demonstrates the complementary benefits of its density and recurrent modules through an ablation study.

type.justification: The paper focuses on empirical results such as testing the RRNADE on synthetic and real-world datasets for online classification and density estimation. It includes tables and figures showing performance comparisons, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: For the empirical studies, we conduct experiments on synthetic data showing RRNADE is able to learn the density function parameterized by a Gaussian HMM and RRNADE is efficient in adapting to concept drifts.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on online learning, particularly involving streaming data.
name.quote: In this paper, we propose the Recurrent Real-valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator (RRNADE), a versatile density estimator for online learning of data streams.

name.justification: One of the major applications discussed in the paper is density estimation for streaming data.
name.quote: We propose the Recurrent Real-valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator (RRNADE), a versatile density estimator for online learning of data streams.

name.justification: The paper also proposes using RRNADE for online classification tasks.
name.quote: Moreover, we propose an RRNADE based Bayes classifier for online classification of streaming data.

name.value: Recurrent Real-Valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator (RRNADE)
name.justification: The model introduced and discussed throughout the paper is the Recurrent Real-valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator (RRNADE).
name.quote: In this paper, we propose the Recurrent Real-valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator (RRNADE), a versatile density estimator for online learning of data streams.

is_contributed.justification: The RRNADE model is introduced and proposed by the authors of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we propose the Recurrent Real-valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator (RRNADE).

is_executed.justification: The model has been executed as part of the experiments conducted in the paper.
is_executed.quote: In this paper, we show that the answer is in the positive. Concretely, our contributions are as follows: 1. We propose the Recurrent Real-valued Neural Autoregressive Density Estimator (RRNADE) ... We present empirical results demonstrating the ability of RRNADE to adapt to concept drifts and approximating density functions with sequential relations.

is_compared.justification: RRNADE is compared numerically to other models in terms of performance metrics like AUC and accuracy in the paper.
is_compared.quote: We also apply RRNADE to online classification tasks on both real world and synthetic datasets and compare it with multiple density based as well as non-density based online classification methods. In almost all of these tasks, RRNADE outperforms the other methods.

referenced_paper_title.justification: RRNADE is not based on a prior specific referenced paper but is a novel contribution by the authors.

name.justification: The Electricity dataset is one of the real-world datasets mentioned in the experiments.
name.quote: The AUC scores on various datasets are presented in Table 1. From this table, we can see all RRNADE variants consistently outperforming the other methods. In addition, in many datasets, e.g. 'Electricity' ... we outperform the best compared method by a significant margin.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Electricity dataset is a common benchmark dataset, and does not refer to a specific paper.

name.justification: The Hyperplane dataset is mentioned as one of the benchmarks for evaluating RRNADE's performance.
name.quote: The AUC scores on various datasets are presented in Table 1. From this table, we can see all RRNADE variants consistently outperforming the other methods. In addition, in many datasets, e.g. 'Electricity', 'Hyperplane' etc., we outperform the best compared method by a significant margin.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Hyperplane dataset is a common benchmark dataset, and does not refer to a specific paper.

name.justification: The Cover Type dataset is used as one of the benchmarks in the experiments within the paper.
name.quote: Note the 'Cover type'...are originally multiclass data streams.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Cover Type dataset is a common benchmark dataset, and does not refer to a specific paper.

name.quote: Note the 'Poker Hand'...are originally multiclass data streams.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Poker Hand dataset is a common benchmark dataset, and does not refer to a specific paper.

name.quote: Note the 'Rialto'...are originally multiclass data streams.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Rialto dataset is a common benchmark dataset, and does not refer to a specific paper.

name.justification: The Sea dataset is used as one of the benchmarks in the experiments within the paper.
name.quote: The AUC scores on various datasets are presented in Table 1. From this table, we can see all RRNADE variants consistently outperforming the other methods. In addition, in many datasets, e.g..'Sea' etc., we outperform the best compared method by a significant margin.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Sea dataset is a common benchmark dataset, and does not refer to a specific paper.

name.justification: The Adam Optimizer is explicitly mentioned as used in the experiments.
name.quote: In all experiments, we use Adam optimizer (Kingma & Ba, 2015).

referenced_paper_title.value: Adam: A Method for Stochastic Optimization
referenced_paper_title.justification: The authors reference the original paper that introduced the Adam Optimizer when mentioning its use.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In all experiments, we use Adam optimizer (Kingma & Ba, 2015).
